result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie Perez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to Roundy's on Case #13CM1723.  To be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09-01-2015.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Cost and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation at the rate of $50.00 per month starting 09/01-2015
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit Random Urine Screens.
No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with:  any Co-Actors and victim stores.
Attend 2 self help meetings per week.
Always have a sponsor.
Obtain a valid driver's license within the First 6 months of Probation.
Provide DNA Sample, if not yet provided and Pay Surcharge.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
filed by the state
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Eddie Perez in court with Attorney Eryn M Menden.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Repeater enhancer is stricken.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Menden makes statements regarding sentencing. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1: IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

3 1/2 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 133 days)
  -  1 1/2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2  YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEARS   **may be transferred to county or state where Defendant resides** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Co-actors and victim stores
____Attend 2 self-help meetings per week 
____Always have a sponsor
____Obtain a valid driver's license within 1st 6 months of probation
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $373.78 - to Roundys on Case #13CM1723  (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 9/1/15)

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid at $50.00 per month, commencing 9/1/15)

CONDITION TIME: 3 Months, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant allowed 2 phone calls for purposes of legal counsel and obtaining bail.  Defendant to have no contact with alleged victim/witness/business listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to have no contact with Pick N Save.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program - exempt while defendant is on Huber Bailee Status. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to disclose all prescriptions to the jail administration.  Defendant granted Huber Bailee status if the signature bond in 14CF1456 is signed.
